intro: Bignonia lanata, commonly known as the woolly morning glory, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and heart-shaped, dark green leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a red throat. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along riverbanks. Bignonia lanata is a fast-growing species that can reach lengths of several meters when supported by a structure.
